word.literal: the second half of the year

sentence.idiomatic: Will housing prices rise or fall in the second half of the year? Let's come listen to an expert's evaluation.
I really like watching this sports show. The two hosts' comments are very exciting.
You're an expert on the auto business. Give everybody your evaluation of each model's strengths and weaknesses.
This software's download volume has been number one for a solid week.
He has the least seniority in his house. His parents and older brother and sister all take special care of him.
Have you seen the pop music rankings? Your favorite singer broke into the top three.
Which search engine do you think works best: Baidu or Google?
You can try an advanced search, maybe you'll get more satisfactory results.
It's easy to look for books. You can search by the title or author's name, or you can search by price.
Just order whatever you like. I'm not that particular about eating.
You have to be particular about giving someone a name. It should have a good meaning, and also sound good.
When you go to be a guest at a Chinese person's home, is there any particular kind of gift you should bring?
Some people think this movie is really good, others say it's terrible. There really are differences of opinion.
There's a proverb that says "to each their own," so we should be understanding about all kinds of opinions.
Everyone has their own opinion. Everyone's advice is only for reference, you need to make up your own mind.
Compared with people born after 1990, we're really out-of-touch.
I like to buy classic styles of clothes that definitely won't go out of style after you've worn them two or three years.
This cell phone has been out of date for a long time. Hurry up and get a new one!
Hey, where can we get some good Shanghainese food? My old classmates and I are having a get together.
Dad, just check out Dianping.com.
Huh?

word.literal: measure word for restaurants and businesses

sentence.idiomatic: Dianping.com! The have evaluations of all kinds of restaurants, written by real people. I use it all the time. Come take a look.
Oh, this thing. How come they don't have restaurants?
They do! Look they list the restaurants and you can search by type of cuisine and location in the city.
Look at this list. Oh man, the ones at the top are so expensive, more than 1,000RMB per person. I bet these restaurants are just taking out ads here.
Well then, look for yourself. Go back to the homepage, pick Shanghainese food, then pick where in the city you want to eat. Where are you planning to go?
Downtown, near People's Square.

There's tons of good restaurants in that area. Let's take a look. See, here are all the Shanghainese restaurants near People's Square. Dad, have a seat and take your time. You can go into each restaurant. They have recommendations by real people, the average cost per person, recommended dishes, even pictures. Tons of information, and it's pretty objective.
These days you really can get anything online. Hey, how are these lists organized?
Usually the best-rated ones are up towards the top.
Hey, how can some people say this place is great, and then other people say the food at the same place is disgusting?
Ah, when you eat out there will always be some differences of opinion. Anyway, if a lot of people say a place is good, it's probably really good.
Looks like your old man is pretty out of touch. My daughter 'gets' this sort of stuff so much more than me. Oh right, looking at so many restaurants in a row, won't your eyes get really tired?
Just pick a price range, here... see?
So anybody off the street can just write a review?
Yeah, that's the only way to keep it really legit. Dad, have a look. I have something to do now, I have to go out for a bit.
Oh, don't go! They have coupons. How do I print them out?
Oh dad, it's really simple. Why don't you try it for yourself?
